docs.text: Welcome to PyCharts++ What is PyCharts++? PyCharts++ is a hierarchical data visualization tool built using Python. What is hierarchical data? Hierarchical data is data where items are linked to each other using parent-child relationships. Hierarchical data exhibits a tree-like structure. What is used to build PyCharts++? PyCharts++ is built using Python. The GUI is built using Tkinter and the charts are generated using Matplotlib . CustomTkinter is used to obtain modern looking widgets for the GUI.

docs.text: Charts PyCharts++ supports the following hierarchical chart types. Treemap Icicle Suburst More information about the supported chart types are provided below. Treemap Treemap represents a hierarchy using rectangles. Each rectangle corresponds to a node in the tree/hierarchy. The area of the rectangle is a representation of the value of the particular node associated with it. A treemap can be used to get an overall idea about the nodes and their values respective to the other nodes. Icicle Sunburst

docs.text: User Guide Installation Usage Basic Usage To generate a chart using PyCharts++, you need to provide a CSV data file in a pre-defined format to the program. See the Data File Preparation section for more information. You can select the data file by clicking on the Select button in the Data section of the Sidebar . Select the Chart Type from the dropdown menu. Click Generate button to generate the chart. Data File Preparation Customize Charts Export Charts
